intro: Tryphia orthoceras, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to rocky and alpine environments in Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and wild plants. The plant features small, green, ovate leaves arranged alternately along its stems. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, a characteristic feature of the Brassicaceae family. Tryphia orthoceras is adapted to harsh conditions, often thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
